intro: Psephellus xanthocephalus, commonly known as the yellow-headed psephellus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained conditions.
